00017 package WeBWorK::ContentGenerator::Hardcopy;
00018 use base qw(WeBWorK::ContentGenerator);

00020 =head1 NAME
00021 
00022 WeBWorK::ContentGenerator::Hardcopy - generate printable versions of one or more
00023 problem sets.
00024 
00025 =cut
00026 
00027 use strict;
00028 use warnings;

00045 =head1 CONFIGURATION VARIABLES
00046 
00047 =over
00048 
00049 =item $PreserveTempFiles
00050 
00051 If true, don't delete temporary files.
00052 
00053 =cut
00054 
00055 our $PreserveTempFiles = 0 unless defined $PreserveTempFiles;
00056 
00057 =back

00060 
00061 our $HC_DEFAULT_FORMAT = "pdf"; # problems if this is not an allowed format for the user...
00062 our %HC_FORMATS = (
00063     tex => { name => "TeX Source", subr => "generate_hardcopy_tex" },
00064     pdf => { name => "Adobe PDF",  subr => "generate_hardcopy_pdf" },
00065     tikz =>{ name => "TIKZ PDF file", subr => "generate_hardcopy_tigz"},
00066 );
00067 
00068 # custom fields used in $self hash
00069 # FOR HEAVEN'S SAKE, PLEASE KEEP THIS UP-TO-DATE!
00070 # 
00071 # final_file_url
00072 #   contains the URL of the final hardcopy file generated
00073 #   set by generate_hardcopy(), used by pre_header_initialize() and body()
00074 # 
00075 # temp_file_map
00076 #   reference to a hash mapping temporary file names to URL
00077 #   set by pre_header_initialize(), used by body()
00078 # 
00079 # hardcopy_errors
00080 #   reference to array containing HTML strings describing generation errors (and warnings)
00081 #   used by add_errors(), get_errors(), get_errors_ref()
00082 # 
00083 # at_least_one_problem_rendered_without_error
00084 #   set to a true value by write_problem_tex if it is able to sucessfully render
00085 #   a problem. checked by generate_hardcopy to determine whether to continue
00086 #   with the generation process.
00087 #
00088 # versioned
00089 #   set to a true value in write_set_tex if the set_id indicates that 
00090 #   the set being rendered is a versioned set; this is used in 
00091 #   write_problem_tex to determine which problem merging routine from 
00092 #   DB.pm to use, and to indicate what problem number in a versioned 
00093 #   test we're on
00094 #
00095 # mergedSets
00096 #   a reference to a hash { userID!setID => setObject }, where setID is 
00097 #   either the set id or the fake versioned set id "setName,vN" depending 
00098 #   on whether the set is a versioned set or not.  this may include the 
00099 #   sets for which the hardcopy is being generated (or may not), depending
00100 #   on whether they were needed to determine the required permissions for 
00101 #   generating a hardcopy
00102 #
00103 # canShowScore
00104 #   a reference to a hash { userID!setID => boolean }, where setID is either 
00105 #   the set id or the fake versioned set id "setName,vN" depending on whether 
00106 #   the set is a versioned set or not, and the value of the boolean is 
00107 #   determined by the corresponding userSet's value of hide_score and the 
00108 #   current time
00109 
00110 ################################################################################
00111 # UI subroutines
00112 ################################################################################
00113 
00114 sub pre_header_initialize {
00115     my ($self) = @_;
00116     my $r = $self->r;
00117     my $ce = $r->ce;
00118     my $db = $r->db;
00119     my $authz = $r->authz;
00120     
00121     my $userID = $r->param("user");
00122     my $eUserID = $r->param("effectiveUser");
00123     my @setIDs = $r->param("selected_sets");
00124     my @userIDs = $r->param("selected_users");
00125     my $hardcopy_format = $r->param("hardcopy_format");
00126     my $generate_hardcopy = $r->param("generate_hardcopy");
00127     my $send_existing_hardcopy = $r->param("send_existing_hardcopy");
00128     my $final_file_url = $r->param("final_file_url");
00129     
00130     # if there's an existing hardcopy file that can be sent, get set up to do that
00131     if ($send_existing_hardcopy) {
00132         $self->reply_with_redirect($final_file_url);
00133         $self->{final_file_url} = $final_file_url;
00134         $self->{send_hardcopy} = 1;
00135         return;
00136     }
00137 
00138     # this should never happen, but apparently it did once (see bug #714), so we check for it
00139     die "Parameter 'user' not defined -- this should never happen" unless defined $userID;
00140     
00141     if ($generate_hardcopy) {
00142         my $validation_failed = 0;
00143         
00144         # set default format
00145         $hardcopy_format = $HC_DEFAULT_FORMAT unless defined $hardcopy_format;
00146         
00147         # make sure format is valid
00148         unless (grep { $_ eq $hardcopy_format } keys %HC_FORMATS) {
00149             $self->addbadmessage("'$hardcopy_format' is not a valid hardcopy format.");
00150             $validation_failed = 1;
00151         }
00152         
00153         # make sure we are allowed to generate hardcopy in this format
00154         unless ($authz->hasPermissions($userID, "download_hardcopy_format_$hardcopy_format")) {
00155             $self->addbadmessage("You do not have permission to generate hardcopy in $hardcopy_format format.");
00156             $validation_failed = 1;
00157         }
00158         
00159         # is there at least one user and set selected?
00160         unless (@userIDs) {
00161             $self->addbadmessage("Please select at least one user and try again.");
00162             $validation_failed = 1;
00163         }   
00164 
00165 # when students don't select any sets the size of @setIDs is 1 with a null character in $setIDs[0].
00166 # when professors don't select any sets the size of @setIDs is 0. 
00167 # the following test "unless ((@setIDs) and ($setIDs[0] =~ /\S+/))" catches both cases and prevents
00168 # warning messages in the case of a professor's empty array.
00169         unless ((@setIDs) and ($setIDs[0] =~ /\S+/)) {
00170             $self->addbadmessage("Please select at least one set and try again.");
00171             $validation_failed = 1;         
00172         }
00173         
00174         # is the user allowed to request multiple sets/users at a time?
00175         my $perm_multiset = $authz->hasPermissions($userID, "download_hardcopy_multiset");
00176         my $perm_multiuser = $authz->hasPermissions($userID, "download_hardcopy_multiuser");
00177         
00178         my $perm_viewhidden = $authz->hasPermissions($userID, "view_hidden_work");
00179         my $perm_viewfromip = $authz->hasPermissions($userID, "view_ip_restricted_sets");
00180         
00181         if (@setIDs > 1 and not $perm_multiset) {
00182             $self->addbadmessage("You are not permitted to generate hardcopy for multiple sets. Please select a single set and try again.");
00183             $validation_failed = 1;
00184         }
00185         if (@userIDs > 1 and not $perm_multiuser) {
00186             $self->addbadmessage("You are not permitted to generate hardcopy for multiple users. Please select a single user and try again.");
00187             $validation_failed = 1;
00188         }
00189         if (@userIDs and $userIDs[0] ne $eUserID and not $perm_multiuser) {
00190             $self->addbadmessage("You are not permitted to generate hardcopy for other users.");
00191             $validation_failed = 1;
00192             # FIXME -- download_hardcopy_multiuser controls both whether a user can generate hardcopy
00193             # that contains sets for multiple users AND whether she can generate hardcopy that contains
00194             # sets for users other than herself. should these be separate permission levels?
00195         }
00196 
00197         # to check if the set has a "hide_work" flag, or if we aren't
00198         #    allowed to view the set from the user's IP address, we 
00199         #    need the userset objects; if we've not failed validation 
00200         #    yet, get those to check on this
00201         my %canShowScore = ();
00202         my %mergedSets = ();
00203         unless ($validation_failed ) {
00204             foreach my $sid ( @setIDs ) {
00205                 my($s,undef,$v) = ($sid =~ /([^,]+)(,v(\d+))?$/);
00206                 foreach my $uid ( @userIDs ) {
00207                     if ( $perm_viewhidden && $perm_viewfromip ) { 
00208                         $canShowScore{"$uid!$sid"} = 1;
00209                     } else {
00210                         my $userSet;
00211                         if ( defined($v) ) {
00212                             $userSet = $db->getMergedSetVersion($uid,$s,$v);
00213                         } else {
00214                             $userSet = $db->getMergedSet($uid,$s);
00215                         }
00216                         $mergedSets{"$uid!$sid"} = $userSet;
00217                         if ( ! $perm_viewhidden &&
00218                              defined( $userSet->hide_work ) &&
00219                              ( $userSet->hide_work eq 'Y' ||
00220                                ( $userSet->hide_work eq 'BeforeAnswerDate' &&
00221                              time < $userSet->answer_date ) ) ) {
00222                             $validation_failed = 1;
00223                             $self->addbadmessage("You are not permitted to generate a hardcopy for a set with hidden work.");
00224                             last;
00225                         }
00226 
00227                         if ( $authz->invalidIPAddress($userSet) ) {
00228                             $validation_failed = 1;
00229                             $self->addbadmessage("You are not allowed to generate a " .
00230                                          "hardcopy for " . $userSet->set_id . 
00231                                          " from your IP address, " .
00232                                          $r->connection->remote_ip . ".");
00233                             last;
00234                         }
00235 
00236                         $canShowScore{"$uid!$sid"} = 
00237                             ( ! defined( $userSet->hide_score ) ||
00238                               $userSet->hide_score eq '' ) ||
00239                             ( $userSet ->hide_score eq 'N' ||
00240                               ( $userSet->hide_score eq 'BeforeAnswerDate' &&
00241                                 time >= $userSet->answer_date ) );
00242 #   die("hide_score = ", $userSet->hide_score, "; canshow{$uid!$sid} = ", (($canShowScore{"$uid!$sid"})?"True":"False"), "\n");
00243 
00244                     }
00245                     last if $validation_failed;
00246                 }
00247             }
00248         }
00249         
00250         unless ($validation_failed) {
00251             $self->{canShowScore} = \%canShowScore;
00252             $self->{mergedSets} = \%mergedSets;
00253             my ($final_file_url, %temp_file_map) = $self->generate_hardcopy($hardcopy_format, \@userIDs, \@setIDs);
00254             if ($self->get_errors) {
00255                 # store the URLs in self hash so that body() can make a link to it
00256                 $self->{final_file_url} = $final_file_url;
00257                 $self->{temp_file_map} = \%temp_file_map;
00258             } else {
00259                 # send the file only
00260                 $self->reply_with_redirect($final_file_url);
00261             }
00262         }
00263     }
00264 }
00265 
00266 sub body {
00267     my ($self) = @_;
00268     my $userID = $self->r->param("user");
00269     my $perm_view_errors = $self->r->authz->hasPermissions($userID, "download_hardcopy_view_errors");
00270     $perm_view_errors = (defined($perm_view_errors) ) ? $perm_view_errors : 0;
00271     if (my $num = $self->get_errors) {
00272         my $final_file_url = $self->{final_file_url};
00273         my %temp_file_map = %{$self->{temp_file_map}};
00274         if($perm_view_errors) {
00275             my $errors_str = $num > 1 ? "errors" : "error";
00276             print CGI::p("$num $errors_str occured while generating hardcopy:");
00277             
00278             print CGI::ul(CGI::li($self->get_errors_ref));
00279         }
00280         
00281         if ($final_file_url) {
00282             print CGI::p(
00283                 "A hardcopy file was generated, but it may not be complete or correct.", 
00284                 "Please check that no problems are missing and that they are all legible." , 
00285                 "If not, please inform your instructor.<br />",
00286                 CGI::a({href=>$final_file_url}, "Download Hardcopy"),
00287             );
00288         } else {
00289             print CGI::p(
00290                 "WeBWorK was unable to generate a paper copy of this homework set.  Please inform your instructor. "
00291             ); 
00292         
00293         }
00294         if($perm_view_errors) {
00295             if (%temp_file_map) {
00296                 print CGI::start_p();
00297                 print "You can also examine the following temporary files: ";
00298                 my $first = 1;
00299                 while (my ($temp_file_name, $temp_file_url) = each %temp_file_map) {
00300                     if ($first) {
00301                         $first = 0;
00302                     } else {
00303                         print ", ";
00304                     }
00305                     print CGI::a({href=>$temp_file_url}, " $temp_file_name");
00306                 }
00307                 print CGI::end_p();
00308             }
00309         }
00310         
00311         print CGI::hr();
00312     }
00313 
00314     # don't display the retry form if there are errors and the user doesn't have permission to view the errors.
00315     unless ($self->get_errors and not $perm_view_errors) {
00316         $self->display_form();
00317     }
00318     ''; # return a blank
00319 }
00320 
00321 sub display_form {
00322     my ($self) = @_;
00323     my $r = $self->r;
00324     my $db = $r->db;
00325     my $authz = $r->authz;
00326     my $userID = $r->param("user");
00327     my $eUserID = $r->param("effectiveUser");
00328     
00329     # first time we show up here, fill in some values
00330     unless ($r->param("in_hc_form")) {
00331         # if a set was passed in via the path_info, add that to the list of sets.
00332         my $singleSet = $r->urlpath->arg("setID");
00333         if (defined $singleSet and $singleSet ne "") {
00334             my @selected_sets = $r->param("selected_sets");
00335             $r->param("selected_sets" => [ @selected_sets, $singleSet]) unless grep { $_ eq $singleSet } @selected_sets;
00336         }
00337         
00338         # if no users are selected, select the effective user
00339         my @selected_users = $r->param("selected_users");
00340         unless (@selected_users) {
00341             $r->param("selected_users" => $eUserID);
00342         }
00343     }
00344     
00345     my $perm_multiset = $authz->hasPermissions($userID, "download_hardcopy_multiset");
00346     my $perm_multiuser = $authz->hasPermissions($userID, "download_hardcopy_multiuser");
00347     my $perm_texformat = $authz->hasPermissions($userID, "download_hardcopy_format_tex");
00348     my $perm_unopened = $authz->hasPermissions($userID, "view_unopened_sets");
00349     my $perm_view_hidden = $authz->hasPermissions($userID, "view_hidden_sets");
00350     
00351     # get formats
00352     my @formats;
00353     foreach my $format (keys %HC_FORMATS) {
00354         push @formats, $format if $authz->hasPermissions($userID, "download_hardcopy_format_$format");
00355     }
00356     
00357     # get format names hash for radio buttons
00358     my %format_labels = map { $_ => $HC_FORMATS{$_}{name} || $_ } @formats;
00359     
00360     # get users for selection
00361     my @Users;
00362     if ($perm_multiuser) {
00363         # if we're allowed to select multiple users, get all the users
00364         # DBFIXME shouldn't need to pass list of users, should use iterator for results?
00365         @Users = $db->getUsers($db->listUsers);
00366     } else {
00367         # otherwise, we get our own record only
00368         @Users = $db->getUser($eUserID);
00369     }
00370     
00371     # get sets for selection
00372     # DBFIXME should use WHERE clause to filter on open_date and visible, rather then getting all
00373     my @globalSetIDs;
00374     my @GlobalSets;
00375     if ($perm_multiuser) {
00376         # if we're allowed to select sets for multiple users, get all sets.
00377         @globalSetIDs = $db->listGlobalSets;
00378         @GlobalSets = $db->getGlobalSets(@globalSetIDs);
00379     } else {
00380         # otherwise, only get the sets assigned to the effective user.
00381         # note that we are getting GlobalSets, but using the list of UserSets assigned to the
00382         # effective user. this is because if we pass UserSets  to ScrollingRecordList it will
00383         # give us composite IDs back, which is a pain in the ass to deal with.
00384         @globalSetIDs = $db->listUserSets($eUserID);
00385         @GlobalSets = $db->getGlobalSets(@globalSetIDs);
00386     }
00387     # we also want to get the versioned sets for this user
00388     # FIXME: this is another place where we assume that there is a 
00389     #    one-to-one correspondence between assignment_type =~ gateway
00390     #    and versioned sets.  I think we really should have a 
00391     #    "is_versioned" flag on set objects instead.
00392     my @versionedSets = grep {$_->assignment_type =~ /gateway/} @GlobalSets;
00393     my @SetVersions = ();
00394     foreach my $v (@versionedSets) {
00395         my @usv = map { [$eUserID, $v->set_id, $_] } ( $db->listSetVersions( $eUserID, $v->set_id ) );
00396         push( @SetVersions, $db->getSetVersions( @usv ) );
00397     }
00398     # FIXME: this is a hideous, horrible hack.  the identifying key for 
00399     #    a global set is the set_id.  those for a set version are the 
00400     #    set_id and version_id.  but this means that we have trouble 
00401     #    displaying them both together in HTML::scrollingRecordList.  
00402     #    so we brutally play tricks with the set_id here, which probably
00403     #    is not very robust, and certainly is aesthetically displeasing.
00404     #    yuck.
00405     foreach ( @SetVersions ) { 
00406         $_->set_id($_->set_id . ",v" . $_->version_id); 
00407     }
00408     
00409     # filter out unwanted sets
00410     my @WantedGlobalSets;
00411     foreach my $i (0 .. $#GlobalSets) {
00412         my $Set = $GlobalSets[$i];
00413         unless (defined $Set) {
00414             warn "\$GlobalSets[$i] (ID $globalSetIDs[$i]) not defined -- skipping";
00415             next;
00416         }
00417         next unless $Set->open_date <= time or $perm_unopened;
00418         next unless $Set->visible or $perm_view_hidden;
00419         # also skip gateway sets, for which we have to have a 
00420         #    version to print something
00421         next if $Set->assignment_type =~ /gateway/;
00422         push @WantedGlobalSets, $Set;
00423     }
00424     
00425     my $scrolling_user_list = scrollingRecordList({
00426         name => "selected_users",
00427         request => $r,
00428         default_sort => "lnfn",
00429         default_format => "lnfn_uid",
00430         default_filters => ["all"],
00431         size => 20,
00432         multiple => $perm_multiuser,
00433     }, @Users);
00434     
00435     my $scrolling_set_list = scrollingRecordList({
00436         name => "selected_sets",
00437         request => $r,
00438         default_sort => "set_id",
00439         default_format => "sid",
00440         default_filters => ["all"],
00441         size => 20,
00442         multiple => $perm_multiset,
00443     }, @WantedGlobalSets, @SetVersions );
00444     
00445     # we change the text a little bit depending on whether the user has multiuser privileges
00446     my $ss = $perm_multiuser ? "s" : "";
00447     my $aa = $perm_multiuser ? " " : " a ";
00448     my $phrase_for_privileged_users = $perm_multiuser ? "to privileged users or" : "";
00449     my $button_label = $perm_multiuser ? "Generate hardcopy for selected sets and selected users" :"Generate hardcopy";
00450     
00451 #   print CGI::start_p();
00452 #   print "Select the homework set$ss for which to generate${aa}hardcopy version$ss.";
00453 #   if ($authz->hasPermissions($userID, "download_hardcopy_multiuser")) {
00454 #       print "You may also select multiple users from the users list. You will receive hardcopy for each (set, user) pair.";
00455 #   }
00456 #   print CGI::end_p();
00457     
00458     print CGI::start_form(-method=>"POST", -action=>$r->uri);
00459     print $self->hidden_authen_fields();
00460     print CGI::hidden("in_hc_form", 1);
00461     
00462     if ($perm_multiuser and $perm_multiset) {
00463         print CGI::p("Select the homework sets for which to generate hardcopy versions. You may"
00464               ." also select multiple users from the users list. You will receive hardcopy" 
00465               ." for each (set, user) pair.");
00466         
00467         print CGI::table({class=>"FormLayout"},
00468             CGI::Tr({},
00469                 CGI::th("Users"),
00470                 CGI::th("Sets"),
00471             ),
00472             CGI::Tr({},
00473                 CGI::td($scrolling_user_list),
00474                 CGI::td($scrolling_set_list),
00475             ),
00476         );
00477     } else { # single user mode
00478         #FIXME -- do a better job of getting the set and the user when in the single set mode
00479         my $selected_set_id = $r->param("selected_sets");
00480         $selected_set_id = '' unless defined $selected_set_id;
00481 
00482         my $selected_user_id = $Users[0]->user_id;
00483         print CGI::hidden("selected_sets",   $selected_set_id ),
00484               CGI::hidden( "selected_users", $selected_user_id);
00485 
00486             # make display for versioned sets a bit nicer
00487         $selected_set_id =~ s/,v(\d+)$/ (test $1)/;
00488         
00489         print CGI::p("Download hardcopy of set ", $selected_set_id, " for ", $Users[0]->first_name, " ",$Users[0]->last_name,"?");
00490     
00491     }
00492     print CGI::table({class=>"FormLayout"},
00493         CGI::Tr({},
00494             CGI::td({colspan=>2, class=>"ButtonRow"},
00495                 CGI::small("You may choose to show any of the following data. Correct answers and solutions are only 
00496                             available $phrase_for_privileged_users after the answer date of the homework set."),
00497                 CGI::br(),
00498                 CGI::b("Show:"), " ",
00499                 CGI::checkbox(
00500                     -name    => "printStudentAnswers",
00501                     -checked => defined($r->param("printStudentAnswers"))? $r->param("printStudentAnswers") : 1, # checked by default
00502                     -label   => "Student answers",
00503                 ),
00504                 CGI::checkbox(
00505                     -name    => "showCorrectAnswers",
00506                     -checked => scalar($r->param("showCorrectAnswers")) || 0,
00507                     -label   => "Correct answers",
00508                 ),
00509                 CGI::checkbox(
00510                     -name    => "showHints",
00511                     -checked => scalar($r->param("showHints")) || 0,
00512                     -label   => "Hints",
00513                 ),
00514                 CGI::checkbox(
00515                     -name    => "showSolutions",
00516                     -checked => scalar($r->param("showSolutions")) || 0,
00517                     -label   => "Solutions",
00518                 ),
00519             ),
00520         ),
00521         CGI::Tr({},
00522             CGI::td({colspan=>2, class=>"ButtonRow"},
00523                 CGI::b("Hardcopy Format:"), " ",
00524                 CGI::radio_group(
00525                     -name    => "hardcopy_format",
00526                     -values  => \@formats,
00527                     -default => scalar($r->param("hardcopy_format")) || $HC_DEFAULT_FORMAT,
00528                     -labels  => \%format_labels,
00529                 ),
00530             ),
00531         ),
00532         CGI::Tr({},
00533             CGI::td({colspan=>2, class=>"ButtonRow"},
00534                 CGI::submit(
00535                     -name => "generate_hardcopy",
00536                     -value => $button_label,
00537                     #-style => "width: 45ex",
00538                 ),
00539             ),
00540         ),
00541     );
00542     
00543     print CGI::end_form();
00544     
00545     return "";
00546 }
00547 
00548 ################################################################################
00549 # harddcopy generating subroutines
00550 ################################################################################
00551 
00552 sub generate_hardcopy {
00553     my ($self, $format, $userIDsRef, $setIDsRef) = @_;
00554     my $r = $self->r;
00555     my $ce = $r->ce;
00556     my $db = $r->db;
00557     my $authz = $r->authz;
00558     
00559     my $courseID = $r->urlpath->arg("courseID");
00560     my $userID = $r->param("user");
00561     my $eUserID = $r->param("effectiveUser");
00562     
00563     # we want to make the temp directory web-accessible, for error reporting
00564     # use mkpath to ensure it exists (mkpath is pretty much ``mkdir -p'')
00565     my $temp_dir_parent_path = $ce->{courseDirs}{html_temp} . "/hardcopy";
00566     eval { mkpath($temp_dir_parent_path) };
00567     if ($@) {
00568         die "Couldn't create hardcopy directory $temp_dir_parent_path: $@";
00569     }
00570     
00571     # create a randomly-named working directory in the hardcopy directory
00572     my $temp_dir_path = eval { tempdir("work.XXXXXXXX", DIR => $temp_dir_parent_path) };
00573     if ($@) {
00574         $self->add_errors("Couldn't create temporary working directory: ".CGI::code(CGI::escapeHTML($@)));
00575         return;
00576     }
00577     # make sure the directory can be read by other daemons e.g. lighttpd
00578     chmod 0755, $temp_dir_path;
00579 
00580     
00581     # do some error checking
00582     unless (-e $temp_dir_path) {
00583         $self->add_errors("Temporary directory '".CGI::code(CGI::escapeHTML($temp_dir_path))
00584             ."' does not exist, but creation didn't fail. This shouldn't happen.");
00585         return;
00586     }
00587     unless (-w $temp_dir_path) {
00588         $self->add_errors("Temporary directory '".CGI::code(CGI::escapeHTML($temp_dir_path))
00589             ."' is not writeable.");
00590         $self->delete_temp_dir($temp_dir_path);
00591         return;
00592     }
00593     
00594     my $tex_file_name = "hardcopy.tex";
00595     my $tex_file_path = "$temp_dir_path/$tex_file_name";
00596     
00597     #######################################
00598     # create TeX file  (callback  write_multiuser_tex,  or ??)
00599     #######################################
00600     
00601     my $open_result = open my $FH, ">", $tex_file_path;
00602     unless ($open_result) {
00603         $self->add_errors("Failed to open file '".CGI::code(CGI::escapeHTML($tex_file_path))
00604             ."' for writing: ".CGI::code(CGI::escapeHTML($!)));
00605         $self->delete_temp_dir($temp_dir_path);
00606         return;
00607     }
00608     $self->write_multiuser_tex($FH, $userIDsRef, $setIDsRef);
00609     close $FH;
00610     
00611     # if no problems got rendered successfully, we can't continue
00612     unless ($self->{at_least_one_problem_rendered_without_error}) {
00613         $self->add_errors("No problems rendered. Can't continue.");
00614         $self->delete_temp_dir($temp_dir_path);
00615         return;
00616     }
00617     
00618     # if no hardcopy.tex file was generated, fail now
00619     unless (-e "$temp_dir_path/hardcopy.tex") {
00620         $self->add_errors("'".CGI::code("hardcopy.tex")."' not written to temporary directory '"
00621             .CGI::code(CGI::escapeHTML($temp_dir_path))."'. Can't continue.");
00622         $self->delete_temp_dir($temp_dir_path);
00623         return;
00624     }
00625     
00626     ##############################################
00627     # end creation of TeX file
00628     ##############################################
00629     
00630     # determine base name of final file
00631     my $final_file_user = @$userIDsRef > 1 ? "multiuser" : $userIDsRef->[0];
00632     my $final_file_set = @$setIDsRef > 1 ? "multiset" : $setIDsRef->[0];
00633     my $final_file_basename = "$courseID.$final_file_user.$final_file_set";
00634     
00635     ###############################################
00636     # call format subroutine  (call back)
00637     ###############################################
00638     # $final_file_name is the name of final hardcopy file
00639     # @temp_files is a list of temporary files of interest used by the subroutine
00640     # (all are relative to $temp_dir_path)
00641     my $format_subr = $HC_FORMATS{$format}{subr};
00642     my ($final_file_name, @temp_files) = $self->$format_subr($temp_dir_path, $final_file_basename);
00643     my $final_file_path = "$temp_dir_path/$final_file_name";
00644     
00645     #warn "final_file_name=$final_file_name\n";
00646     #warn "temp_files=@temp_files\n";
00647     
00648     ################################################
00649     # calculate URLs for each temp file of interest
00650     #################################################
00651     # makeTempDirectory's interface forces us to reverse-engineer the name of the temp dir from the path
00652     my $temp_dir_parent_url = $ce->{courseURLs}{html_temp} . "/hardcopy";
00653     (my $temp_dir_url = $temp_dir_path) =~ s/^$temp_dir_parent_path/$temp_dir_parent_url/; 
00654     my %temp_file_map;
00655     foreach my $temp_file_name (@temp_files) {
00656         $temp_file_map{$temp_file_name} = "$temp_dir_url/$temp_file_name";
00657     }
00658     
00659     my $final_file_url;
00660     
00661     ##################################################
00662     # make sure final file exists
00663     ##################################################
00664     # returns undefined unless $final_file_path points to a file
00665     unless (-e $final_file_path) {
00666         $self->add_errors("Final hardcopy file '".CGI::code(CGI::escapeHTML($final_file_path))
00667             ."' not found after calling '".CGI::code(CGI::escapeHTML($format_subr))."': "
00668             .CGI::code(CGI::escapeHTML($!)));
00669         return $final_file_url, %temp_file_map;
00670     }
00671     
00672     ##################################################  
00673     # try to move the hardcopy file out of the temp directory
00674     ##################################################
00675 
00676     # set $final_file_url accordingly
00677     my $final_file_final_path = "$temp_dir_parent_path/$final_file_name";
00678     my $mv_cmd = "2>&1 " . $ce->{externalPrograms}{mv} . " " . shell_quote($final_file_path, $final_file_final_path);
00679     my $mv_out = readpipe $mv_cmd;
00680     if ($?) {
00681         $self->add_errors("Failed to move hardcopy file '".CGI::code(CGI::escapeHTML($final_file_name))
00682             ."' from '".CGI::code(CGI::escapeHTML($temp_dir_path))."' to '"
00683             .CGI::code(CGI::escapeHTML($temp_dir_parent_path))."':".CGI::br()
00684             .CGI::pre(CGI::escapeHTML($mv_out)));
00685         $final_file_url = "$temp_dir_url/$final_file_name";
00686     } else {
00687         $final_file_url = "$temp_dir_parent_url/$final_file_name";
00688     }
00689     
00690     ##################################################  
00691     # remove the temp directory if there are no errors
00692     ##################################################
00693 
00694     unless ($self->get_errors or $PreserveTempFiles) {
00695         $self->delete_temp_dir($temp_dir_path);
00696     }
00697     
00698     warn "Preserved temporary files in directory '$temp_dir_path'.\n" if $PreserveTempFiles;
00699     
00700     return $final_file_url, %temp_file_map;
00701 }
00702 
00703 # helper function to remove temp dirs
00704 sub delete_temp_dir {
00705     my ($self, $temp_dir_path) = @_;
00706     
00707     my $rm_cmd = "2>&1 " . $self->r->ce->{externalPrograms}{rm} . " -rf " . shell_quote($temp_dir_path);
00708     my $rm_out = readpipe $rm_cmd;
00709     if ($?) {
00710         $self->add_errors("Failed to remove temporary directory '".CGI::code(CGI::escapeHTML($temp_dir_path))."':"
00711             .CGI::br().CGI::pre($rm_out));
00712         return 0;
00713     } else {
00714         return 1;
00715     }
00716 }
00717 
00718 # format subroutines
00719 # 
00720 # assume that TeX source is located at $temp_dir_path/hardcopy.tex
00721 # the generated file will being with $final_file_basename
00722 # first element of return value is the name of the generated file (relative to $temp_dir_path)
00723 # rest of return value elements are names of temporary files that may be of interest in the
00724 #   case of an error, relative to $temp_dir_path. these are returned whether or not an error
00725 #   actually occured.
00726 
00727 sub generate_hardcopy_tex {
00728     my ($self, $temp_dir_path, $final_file_basename) = @_;
00729     
00730     my $final_file_name;
00731     
00732     # try to rename tex file
00733     my $src_name = "hardcopy.tex";
00734     my $dest_name = "$final_file_basename.tex";
00735     my $mv_cmd = "2>&1 " . $self->r->ce->{externalPrograms}{mv} . " " . shell_quote("$temp_dir_path/$src_name", "$temp_dir_path/$dest_name");
00736     my $mv_out = readpipe $mv_cmd;
00737     if ($?) {
00738         $self->add_errors("Failed to rename '".CGI::code(CGI::escapeHTML($src_name))."' to '"
00739             .CGI::code(CGI::escapeHTML($dest_name))."' in directory '"
00740             .CGI::code(CGI::escapeHTML($temp_dir_path))."':".CGI::br()
00741             .CGI::pre(CGI::escapeHTML($mv_out)));
00742         $final_file_name = $src_name;
00743     } else {
00744         $final_file_name = $dest_name;
00745     }
00746     
00747     return $final_file_name;
00748 }
00749 
00750 sub generate_hardcopy_pdf {
00751     my ($self, $temp_dir_path, $final_file_basename) = @_;
00752     
00753     # call pdflatex - we don't want to chdir in the mod_perl process, as
00754     # that might step on the feet of other things (esp. in Apache 2.0)
00755     my $pdflatex_cmd = "cd " . shell_quote($temp_dir_path) . " && "
00756         . $self->r->ce->{externalPrograms}{pdflatex}
00757         . " >pdflatex.stdout 2>pdflatex.stderr hardcopy";
00758     if (my $rawexit = system $pdflatex_cmd) {
00759         my $exit = $rawexit >> 8;
00760         my $signal = $rawexit & 127;
00761         my $core = $rawexit & 128;
00762         $self->add_errors("Failed to convert TeX to PDF with command '"
00763             .CGI::code(CGI::escapeHTML($pdflatex_cmd))."' (exit=$exit signal=$signal core=$core).");
00764         
00765         # read hardcopy.log and report first error
00766         my $hardcopy_log = "$temp_dir_path/hardcopy.log";
00767         if (-e $hardcopy_log) {
00768             if (open my $LOG, "<", $hardcopy_log) {
00769                 my $line;
00770                 while ($line = <$LOG>) {
00771                     last if $line =~ /^!\s+/;
00772                 }
00773                 my $first_error = $line;
00774                 while ($line = <$LOG>) {
00775                     last if $line =~ /^!\s+/;
00776                     $first_error .= $line;
00777                 }
00778                 close $LOG;
00779                 if (defined $first_error) {
00780                     $self->add_errors("First error in TeX log is:".CGI::br().
00781                         CGI::pre(CGI::escapeHTML($first_error)));
00782                 } else {
00783                     $self->add_errors("No errors encoundered in TeX log.");
00784                 }
00785             } else {
00786                 $self->add_errors("Could not read TeX log: ".CGI::code(CGI::escapeHTML($!)));
00787             }
00788         } else {
00789             $self->add_errors("No TeX log was found.");
00790         }
00791     }
00792     
00793     my $final_file_name;
00794     
00795     # try rename the pdf file
00796     my $src_name = "hardcopy.pdf";
00797     my $dest_name = "$final_file_basename.pdf";
00798     my $mv_cmd = "2>&1 " . $self->r->ce->{externalPrograms}{mv} . " " . shell_quote("$temp_dir_path/$src_name", "$temp_dir_path/$dest_name");
00799     my $mv_out = readpipe $mv_cmd;
00800     if ($?) {
00801         $self->add_errors("Failed to rename '".CGI::code(CGI::escapeHTML($src_name))."' to '"
00802             .CGI::code(CGI::escapeHTML($dest_name))."' in directory '"
00803             .CGI::code(CGI::escapeHTML($temp_dir_path))."':".CGI::br()
00804             .CGI::pre(CGI::escapeHTML($mv_out)));
00805         $final_file_name = $src_name;
00806     } else {
00807         $final_file_name = $dest_name;
00808     }
00809     
00810     return $final_file_name, qw/hardcopy.tex hardcopy.log hardcopy.aux pdflatex.stdout pdflatex.stderr/;
00811 }
00812 
00813 ################################################################################
00814 # TeX aggregating subroutines
00815 ################################################################################
00816 
00817 sub write_multiuser_tex {
00818     my ($self, $FH, $userIDsRef, $setIDsRef) = @_;
00819     my $r = $self->r;
00820     my $ce = $r->ce;
00821     
00822     my @userIDs = @$userIDsRef;
00823     my @setIDs = @$setIDsRef;
00824     
00825     # get snippets
00826     my $preamble = $ce->{webworkFiles}->{hardcopySnippets}->{preamble};
00827     my $postamble = $ce->{webworkFiles}->{hardcopySnippets}->{postamble};
00828     my $divider = $ce->{webworkFiles}->{hardcopySnippets}->{userDivider};
00829     
00830     # write preamble
00831     $self->write_tex_file($FH, $preamble);
00832     
00833     # write section for each user
00834     while (defined (my $userID = shift @userIDs)) {
00835         $self->write_multiset_tex($FH, $userID, @setIDs);
00836         $self->write_tex_file($FH, $divider) if @userIDs; # divide users, but not after the last user
00837     }
00838     
00839     # write postamble
00840     $self->write_tex_file($FH, $postamble);
00841 }
00842 
00843 sub write_multiset_tex {
00844     my ($self, $FH, $targetUserID, @setIDs) = @_;
00845     my $r = $self->r;
00846     my $ce = $r->ce;
00847     my $db = $r->db;
00848     
00849     # get user record
00850     my $TargetUser = $db->getUser($targetUserID); # checked
00851     unless ($TargetUser) {
00852         $self->add_errors("Can't generate hardcopy for user '".CGI::code(CGI::escapeHTML($targetUserID))."' -- no such user exists.\n");
00853         return;
00854     }
00855     
00856     # get set divider
00857     my $divider = $ce->{webworkFiles}->{hardcopySnippets}->{setDivider};
00858     
00859     # write each set
00860     while (defined (my $setID = shift @setIDs)) {
00861         $self->write_set_tex($FH, $TargetUser, $setID);
00862         $self->write_tex_file($FH, $divider) if @setIDs; # divide sets, but not after the last set
00863     }
00864 }
00865 
00866 sub write_set_tex {
00867     my ($self, $FH, $TargetUser, $setID) = @_;
00868     my $r = $self->r;
00869     my $ce = $r->ce;
00870     my $db = $r->db;
00871     my $authz  = $r->authz;
00872     my $userID = $r->param("user");
00873 
00874     # we may already have the MergedSet from checking hide_work and 
00875     #    hide_score in pre_header_initialize; check to see if that's true,
00876     #    and otherwise, get the set.
00877     my %mergedSets = %{$self->{mergedSets}};
00878     my $uid = $TargetUser->user_id;
00879     my $MergedSet;
00880     my $versioned = 0;
00881     if ( defined( $mergedSets{"$uid!$setID"} ) ) {
00882         $MergedSet = $mergedSets{"$uid!$setID"};
00883         $versioned = ($setID =~ /,v(\d+)$/) ? $1 : 0;
00884     } else {
00885         if ( $setID =~ /(.+),v(\d+)$/ ) {
00886             $setID = $1;
00887             $versioned = $2;
00888         }
00889         if ( $versioned ) {
00890             $MergedSet = $db->getMergedSetVersion($TargetUser->user_id, $setID, $versioned);
00891         } else {
00892             $MergedSet = $db->getMergedSet($TargetUser->user_id, $setID); # checked
00893         }
00894     }
00895     # save versioned info for use in write_problem_tex
00896     $self->{versioned} = $versioned;
00897 
00898     unless ($MergedSet) {
00899         $self->add_errors("Can't generate hardcopy for set ''".CGI::code(CGI::escapeHTML($setID))
00900             ."' for user '".CGI::code(CGI::escapeHTML($TargetUser->user_id))
00901             ."' -- set is not assigned to that user.");
00902         return;
00903     }
00904     
00905     # see if the *real* user is allowed to access this problem set
00906     if ($MergedSet->open_date > time and not $authz->hasPermissions($userID, "view_unopened_sets")) {
00907         $self->add_errors("Can't generate hardcopy for set '".CGI::code(CGI::escapeHTML($setID))
00908             ."' for user '".CGI::code(CGI::escapeHTML($TargetUser->user_id))
00909             ."' -- set is not yet open.");
00910         return;
00911     }
00912     if (not $MergedSet->visible and not $authz->hasPermissions($userID, "view_hidden_sets")) {
00913         $self->addbadmessage("Can't generate hardcopy for set '".CGI::code(CGI::escapeHTML($setID))
00914             ."' for user '".CGI::code(CGI::escapeHTML($TargetUser->user_id))
00915             ."' -- set is not visible to students.");
00916         return;
00917     }
00918     
00919     # get snippets
00920     my $header = $MergedSet->hardcopy_header
00921         ? $MergedSet->hardcopy_header
00922         : $ce->{webworkFiles}->{hardcopySnippets}->{setHeader};
00923   if ($header eq 'defaultHeader') {$header = $ce->{webworkFiles}->{hardcopySnippets}->{setHeader};}
00924     my $footer = $ce->{webworkFiles}->{hardcopySnippets}->{setFooter};
00925     my $divider = $ce->{webworkFiles}->{hardcopySnippets}->{problemDivider};
00926     
00927     # get list of problem IDs
00928     # DBFIXME use ORDER BY in database
00929     my @problemIDs = sort { $a <=> $b } $db->listUserProblems($MergedSet->user_id, $MergedSet->set_id);
00930 
00931     # for versioned sets (gateways), we might have problems in a random
00932     # order; reset the order of the problemIDs if this is the case
00933     if ( defined( $MergedSet->problem_randorder ) && 
00934          $MergedSet->problem_randorder ) {
00935         my @newOrder = ();
00936 
00937     # to set the same order each time we set the random seed to the psvn,
00938     # and to avoid messing with the system random number generator we use
00939     # our own PGrandom object
00940         my $pgrand = PGrandom->new();
00941         $pgrand->srand( $MergedSet->psvn );
00942         while ( @problemIDs ) {
00943             my $i = int($pgrand->rand(scalar(@problemIDs)));
00944             push( @newOrder, $problemIDs[$i] );
00945             splice(@problemIDs, $i, 1);
00946         }
00947         @problemIDs = @newOrder;
00948     }
00949             
00950     
00951     # write set header
00952     $self->write_problem_tex($FH, $TargetUser, $MergedSet, 0, $header); # 0 => pg file specified directly
00953     
00954     # write each problem
00955     # for versioned problem sets (gateway tests) we like to include 
00956     #   problem numbers
00957     my $i = 1;
00958     while (my $problemID = shift @problemIDs) {
00959         $self->write_tex_file($FH, $divider);
00960         $self->{versioned} = $i if $versioned;
00961         $self->write_problem_tex($FH, $TargetUser, $MergedSet, $problemID);
00962         $i++;
00963     }
00964     
00965     # write footer
00966     $self->write_problem_tex($FH, $TargetUser, $MergedSet, 0, $footer); # 0 => pg file specified directly
00967 }
00968 
00969 sub write_problem_tex {
00970     my ($self, $FH, $TargetUser, $MergedSet, $problemID, $pgFile) = @_;
00971     my $r = $self->r;
00972     my $ce = $r->ce;
00973     my $db = $r->db;
00974     my $authz  = $r->authz;
00975     my $userID = $r->param("user");
00976     my $versioned = $self->{versioned};
00977     my %canShowScore = %{$self->{canShowScore}};
00978 
00979     my @errors;
00980     
00981     # get problem record
00982     my $MergedProblem;
00983     if ($problemID) {
00984         # a non-zero problem ID was given -- load that problem
00985             # we use $versioned to determine which merging routine to use
00986         if ( $versioned ) {
00987             $MergedProblem = $db->getMergedProblemVersion($MergedSet->user_id, $MergedSet->set_id, $MergedSet->version_id, $problemID);
00988 
00989         } else {
00990             $MergedProblem = $db->getMergedProblem($MergedSet->user_id, $MergedSet->set_id, $problemID); # checked
00991         }
00992         
00993         # handle nonexistent problem
00994         unless ($MergedProblem) {
00995             $self->add_errors("Can't generate hardcopy for problem '"
00996                 .CGI::code(CGI::escapeHTML($problemID))."' in set '"
00997                 .CGI::code(CGI::escapeHTML($MergedSet->set_id))
00998                 ."' for user '".CGI::code(CGI::escapeHTML($MergedSet->user_id))
00999                 ."' -- problem does not exist in that set or is not assigned to that user.");
01000             return;
01001         }
01002     } elsif ($pgFile) {
01003         # otherwise, we try an explicit PG file
01004         $MergedProblem = $db->newUserProblem(
01005             user_id => $MergedSet->user_id,
01006             set_id => $MergedSet->set_id,
01007             problem_id => 0,
01008             source_file => $pgFile,
01009             num_correct   => 0,
01010             num_incorrect => 0,
01011         );
01012         die "newUserProblem failed -- WTF?" unless $MergedProblem; # this should never happen
01013     } else {
01014         # this shouldn't happen -- error out for real
01015         die "write_problem_tex needs either a non-zero \$problemID or a \$pgFile";
01016     }
01017     
01018     # figure out if we're allowed to get correct answers, hints, and solutions
01019     # (eventually, we'd like to be able to use the same code as Problem)
01020     my $versionName = $MergedSet->set_id . 
01021         (( $versioned ) ?  ",v" . $MergedSet->version_id : '');
01022 
01023     my $showCorrectAnswers  = $r->param("showCorrectAnswers") || 0;
01024     my $printStudentAnswers = $r->param("printStudentAnswers") || 0;
01025     my $showHints           = $r->param("showHints")          || 0;
01026     my $showSolutions       = $r->param("showSolutions")      || 0;
01027 
01028     unless( ( $authz->hasPermissions($userID, "show_correct_answers_before_answer_date") or
01029           ( time > $MergedSet->answer_date or 
01030             ( $versioned && 
01031               $MergedProblem->num_correct + 
01032               $MergedProblem->num_incorrect >= 
01033               $MergedSet->attempts_per_version &&
01034               $MergedSet->due_date == $MergedSet->answer_date ) ) ) &&
01035         ( $canShowScore{$MergedSet->user_id . "!$versionName"} ) ) {
01036         $showCorrectAnswers = 0;
01037         $showSolutions      = 0;
01038     }
01039     
01040     # FIXME -- there can be a problem if the $siteDefaults{timezone} is not defined?  Why is this?
01041     # why does it only occur with hardcopy?
01042 
01043     # we need an additional translation option for versioned sets; also,
01044     #   for versioned sets include old answers in the set if we're also 
01045     #   asking for the answers
01046     my $transOpts = 
01047         { # translation options
01048             displayMode     => "tex",
01049             showHints       => $showHints          ? 1 : 0, # insure that this value is numeric
01050             showSolutions   => $showSolutions      ? 1 : 0, # (or what? -sam)
01051             processAnswers  => ($showCorrectAnswers || $printStudentAnswers) ? 1 : 0,
01052             permissionLevel => $db->getPermissionLevel($userID)->permission,
01053         };
01054 
01055     if ( $versioned && $MergedProblem->problem_id != 0 ) {
01056 
01057         $transOpts->{QUIZ_PREFIX} = 'Q' . sprintf("%04d",$MergedProblem->problem_id()) . '_';
01058 
01059     }
01060     my $formFields = { };
01061     if ( $showCorrectAnswers ||$printStudentAnswers ) { 
01062             my %oldAnswers = decodeAnswers($MergedProblem->last_answer);
01063             $formFields->{$_} = $oldAnswers{$_} foreach (keys %oldAnswers);
01064             print $FH "%% decoded old answers, saved. (keys = " . join(',', keys(%oldAnswers)) . "\n";
01065         }
01066 
01067 #   warn("problem ", $MergedProblem->problem_id, ": source = ", $MergedProblem->source_file, "\n");
01068 
01069     my $pg = WeBWorK::PG->new(
01070         $ce,
01071         $TargetUser,
01072         scalar($r->param('key')), # avoid multiple-values problem
01073         $MergedSet,
01074         $MergedProblem,
01075         $MergedSet->psvn,
01076         $formFields, # no form fields!
01077         $transOpts,
01078     );
01079     
01080     # only bother to generate this info if there were warnings or errors
01081     my $edit_url;
01082     my $problem_name;
01083     my $problem_desc;
01084     if ($pg->{warnings} ne "" or $pg->{flags}->{error_flag}) {
01085         my $edit_urlpath = $r->urlpath->newFromModule(
01086             "WeBWorK::ContentGenerator::Instructor::PGProblemEditor", $r,
01087             courseID  => $r->urlpath->arg("courseID"),
01088             setID     => $MergedProblem->set_id,
01089             problemID => $MergedProblem->problem_id,
01090         );
01091         
01092         if ($MergedProblem->problem_id == 0) {
01093             # link for an fake problem (like a header file)
01094             $edit_url = $self->systemLink($edit_urlpath,
01095                 params => {
01096                     sourceFilePath => $MergedProblem->source_file,
01097                     problemSeed    => $MergedProblem->problem_seed,
01098                 },
01099             );
01100         } else {
01101             # link for a real problem
01102             $edit_url = $self->systemLink($edit_urlpath);
01103         }
01104         
01105         if ($MergedProblem->problem_id == 0) {
01106             $problem_name = "snippet";
01107             $problem_desc = $problem_name." '".$MergedProblem->source_file
01108                 ."' for set '".$MergedProblem->set_id."' and user '"
01109                 .$MergedProblem->user_id."'";
01110         } else {
01111             $problem_name = "problem";
01112             $problem_desc = $problem_name." '".$MergedProblem->problem_id
01113                 ."' in set '".$MergedProblem->set_id."' for user '"
01114                 .$MergedProblem->user_id."'";
01115         }
01116     }
01117         
01118     # deal with PG warnings
01119     if ($pg->{warnings} ne "") {
01120         $self->add_errors(CGI::a({href=>$edit_url, target=>"WW_Editor"}, "[edit]")
01121             ." Warnings encountered while processing $problem_desc. "
01122             ."Error text:".CGI::br().CGI::pre(CGI::escapeHTML($pg->{warnings}))
01123         );
01124     }
01125     
01126     # deal with PG errors
01127     if ($pg->{flags}->{error_flag}) {
01128         $self->add_errors(CGI::a({href=>$edit_url, target=>"WW_Editor"}, "[edit]")
01129             ." Errors encountered while processing $problem_desc. "
01130             ."This $problem_name has been omitted from the hardcopy. "
01131             ."Error text:".CGI::br().CGI::pre(CGI::escapeHTML($pg->{errors}))
01132         );
01133         return;
01134     }
01135     
01136     # if we got here, there were no errors (because errors cause a return above)
01137     $self->{at_least_one_problem_rendered_without_error} = 1;
01138 
01139     print $FH "{\\bf Problem $versioned.}\n" 
01140         if ( $versioned && $MergedProblem->problem_id != 0 );
01141     print $FH $pg->{body_text};
01142 
01143     my @ans_entry_order = defined($pg->{flags}->{ANSWER_ENTRY_ORDER}) ? @{$pg->{flags}->{ANSWER_ENTRY_ORDER}} : ( );
01144 
01145     # print the list of student answers if it is requested
01146     if (  $printStudentAnswers && 
01147          $MergedProblem->problem_id != 0 && @ans_entry_order ) {
01148             my $recScore = $pg->{state}->{recorded_score};
01149             my $corrMsg = '';
01150             if ( $recScore == 1 ) {
01151                 $corrMsg = ' (correct)';
01152             } elsif ( $recScore == 0 ) {
01153                 $corrMsg = ' (incorrect)';
01154             } else {
01155                 $corrMsg = " (score $recScore)";
01156             }
01157         my $stuAnswers = "\\par{\\small{\\it Answer(s) submitted:}\n" .
01158             "\\vspace{-\\parskip}\\begin{itemize}\n";
01159         for my $ansName ( @ans_entry_order ) {
01160             my $stuAns = $pg->{answers}->{$ansName}->{original_student_ans};
01161             $stuAnswers .= "\\item\\begin{verbatim}$stuAns\\end{verbatim}\n";
01162         }
01163         $stuAnswers .= "\\end{itemize}}$corrMsg\\par\n";
01164         print $FH $stuAnswers;
01165     }
01166     
01167     # write the list of correct answers is appropriate; ANSWER_ENTRY_ORDER
01168     #   isn't defined for versioned sets?  this seems odd FIXME  GWCHANGE
01169     if ($showCorrectAnswers && $MergedProblem->problem_id != 0 && @ans_entry_order) {
01170         my $correctTeX = "\\par{\\small{\\it Correct Answers:}\n"
01171             . "\\vspace{-\\parskip}\\begin{itemize}\n";
01172         
01173         foreach my $ansName (@ans_entry_order) {
01174             my $correctAnswer = $pg->{answers}->{$ansName}->{correct_ans};
01175             $correctTeX .= "\\item\\begin{verbatim}$correctAnswer\\end{verbatim}\n";
01176             # FIXME: What about vectors (where TeX will complain about < and > outside of math mode)?
01177         }
01178         
01179         $correctTeX .= "\\end{itemize}}\\par\n";
01180         
01181         print $FH $correctTeX;
01182     }
01183 }
01184 
01185 sub write_tex_file {
01186     my ($self, $FH, $file) = @_;
01187     
01188     my $tex = eval { readFile($file) };
01189     if ($@) {
01190         $self->add_errors("Failed to include TeX file '".CGI::code(CGI::escapeHTML($file))."': "
01191             .CGI::escapeHTML($@));
01192     } else {
01193         print $FH $tex;
01194     }
01195 }
01196 
01197 ################################################################################
01198 # utilities
01199 ################################################################################
01200 
01201 sub add_errors {
01202     my ($self, @errors) = @_;
01203     push @{$self->{hardcopy_errors}}, @errors;
01204 }
01205 
01206 sub get_errors {
01207     my ($self) = @_;
01208     return $self->{hardcopy_errors} ? @{$self->{hardcopy_errors}} : ();
01209 }
01210 
01211 sub get_errors_ref {
01212     my ($self) = @_;
01213     return $self->{hardcopy_errors};
01214 }
